meanings.definition: The arrangement of columns in a structure.
meanings.sent1: The columniations of the ancient temple were truly impressive.
meanings.sent2: The architect carefully planned the columniations of the new building.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous children pretended to be living columniations in their game of make-believe.
meanings.sent4: The row of trees along the path created a natural columniation guiding the way.
meanings.sent5: The grand hall's columniations stood tall and majestic, leaving visitors in awe.

meanings.sent1: The columniations of the soldiers marching in formation were precise.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers were busy with the columniations of the support beams.
meanings.sent3: The chef's columniations of ingredients on the cutting board resembled a work of art.
meanings.sent4: The students' columniations in the assembly impressed the teachers with their discipline.
meanings.sent5: The columniations of books on the shelf made it easy to find the right one.

meanings.definition: The process of aligning columns in a row.
meanings.sent1: The columniations of the fence posts ensured a straight boundary.
meanings.sent2: The workers focused on the columniations of the steel beams for the bridge.
meanings.sent3: The ants' columniations as they carried food back to their nest were fascinating to watch.
meanings.sent4: The columniations of clouds in the sky created a beautiful pattern at sunset.
meanings.sent5: The meticulous columniations of the trophies on the shelf displayed the team's achievements.
